title: Good light, circular font
content:
I can't remember names of these fonts, but does anyone know of a good light almost perfectly circular shaped font? Similar to [http://www.terminaldesign.com/custom\_mag\_vanFair\_01\_b.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029051909/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/custom_mag_vanFair_01_b.shtml)   
   
Thank you.
author: robsayshowdy

comments.content: Perfect. All of them are amazing, a few i had used, ie avenir and futura and nobel (dtl version). But I think neutraface is what I need. Thanks.

Yeah, I realized which font i was thinking of, not the name, but the source. Neiman Marcus' "the book" cover font and used inside as well, i think im going to post a request over with yves later. (i do think it's neutra)

Have a look at the light weights of these:   
   
 [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029051909/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdisplay&displayfontid=BT.107591.0.1&packagefontid=0&view=single&searchID=0&searchby=keyword&searchletter=A&searchstr=futura&totalrecords=354&startrow=201&records=100&currpage=3)   
 [Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029051909/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=NEUTRAFACE-FO&sub=inuse)   
 [FB Nobel](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029051909/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdisplay&displayfontid=FB.116809.0.2&packagefontid=0&view=single&searchID=0&searchby=keyword&searchletter=A&searchstr=nobel&totalrecords=21&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1)

I hope that's what you mean. Or maybe you're thinking something   
more like [Monica](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029051909/http:/fsd.it/fonts/mon.htm)?
Neutraface is wonderful, but it is very quirky. But I guess that is why I like it because it isn't easy to use. I only wish it came in postscript so I could use it in Quirk too.

Hey,  
Check out Neutraface No.2 - available from House Industries!  
Best,
